title.narrative: infoDev MTDF on innovation and entrepreneurship
infoDev multigivarfond inom innovation och entreprenörskap

description.narrative: Mobile subscriptions recently reached 6 billion, and almost 75% of those are found in developing countries. But the potential of mobile phones in developing countries are still largely untapped. Mobile applications today are mainly related to sports, entertainment and music. They have great potential to foster inclusive growth, by giving access to services, products and markets to parts of the world unreachable through other existing infrastructure. Mobile phones can assist people living in poverty to improve their living conditions and it can provide access or removal of discriminatory barriers for vulnerable groups.The intervention targets the problem by trying to facilitate demand-driven, sustained and scalable mobile entrepreneurship and to jumpstart a thriving local mobile content industry which fosters social entrepreneurship. This will be done through the support and nurturing of innovative businesses in emerging markets. Key activities include the creation of mobile hubs (mHubs) which provide entrepreneurs with technical assistance, networking opportunities, capacity development, infrastructure (broadband and testing facilities) and office space.

Stöd till sociala entreprenörer inom mobilteknologi genom s.k. mobile hubs och mobile laboratories (mHubs/mLabs). Syftet är att mHubs/mLabs ska hjälpa entreprenörer att konkretisera och realisera sina idéer (from mind to market). Särskilt fokus på kvinnliga entreprenörer och entreprenörer från botten av pyramiden (BoP).

Support to social entrepreneurs within mobile technology through mobile hubs and mobile laboratories (mHubs/mLabs). The purpose is that mHubs/mLabs should faciltiate the transfer of ideas from mind to market. Specific focus is on women entrepreneurs and entrepreneurs at the bottom of the pyramid (BoP).

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

tag.narrative: 2.4 - By 2030, ensure sustainable food production systems and implement resilient agricultural practices that increase productivity and production, that help maintain ecosystems, that strengthen capacity for adaptation to climate change, extreme weather, drought, flooding and other disasters and that progressively improve land and soil quality.

2.4 - Senast 2030 uppnå hållbara system för livsmedelsproduktion samt införa motståndskraftiga jordbruksmetoder som ökar produktiviteten och produktionen, som bidrar till att upprätthålla ekosystemen, som stärker förmågan till anpassning till klimatförändringar, extrema väderförhållanden, torka, översvämning och andra katastrofer och som successivt förbättrar mark- och jordkvaliteten.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Although changed circumstances, infoDev has still achieved key activity milestones set forFY2015. This includes securing a range of partnerships, influencing several large scale WBGoperations, operationalized a rigorous results framework, and obtained significant visibility intraditional and social media through its communications endeavours.Other, more specific, progress towards the intended outcomes for the DigitalEntrepreneurship Program includes:- The Department of Science and Technology and the State ICT Agency in South Africa andSenegal respectively agreed to provide significant co-financing to the mLabs in both locations.- Slush and Demo both formed partnerships with infoDev to ensure participation of mLabentrepreneurs in these renown start-up events in Europe and Africa.- Emory University opened its research on acceleration globally for infoDev’s participation.- infoDev also worked actively with the mLabs in Kenya, Senegal and South Africa toexchange lessons on progress to-date and to derive a common action plan and resultsframework going forward.- Preparatory activities for the design and launch of the pan-African acceleration pilot tookplace.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published

strategy.titleSV: Sveriges globala utvecklingssamarbete inom hållbar ekonomisk utveckling 2018-2022
